CHRYSLER, FORD CAUTIOUS But on Monday Chrysler Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said that industry-wide sales had fallen off in the final weeks of the month, which typically account for the bulk of sales. We've seen a softening of the U.S. market in the last couple of weeks, Sergio Marchionne told reporters on a conference call to discuss Chrysler's fourth-quarter results. Sergio Marchionne forecast a sales rate of near 12.4 million to 12.5 million vehicles for the month. Chrysler is 25 percent owned by Italy

TECHWATCH- WSJ 4-col. lead, "Power Shifts Atop Google: Internet Giant Says Co-Founder Larry Page Will Replace CEO Eric Schmidt ," by Amir Efrati and Jessica Vascellaro : Eric Schmidt [ age 55], who has been chairman and CEO but shared decision-making with Walt Disney Page and co-founder Sergey Brin [ age 37], is stepping aside in April into the new post of executive chairman.... Walt Disney Page, 38, will take over day-to-day operations April 4.
